name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Thick Skinned
abilities.text: Snorlax can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Snorlax is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pok√©mon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

strengths: 90 HP is excellent for a Basic Pokemon
Thick Skinned prevents most status conditions
weaknesses: Fighting weakness is dangerous against Hitmonchan
Body Slam paralysis is coin-flip dependent
Thick Skinned can be disabled by Muk or Goop Gas Attack
synergies: Double Colorless Energy - helps reach Body Slam cost
Dark Vileplume - locks Trainers while Snorlax walls
counters: Muk - Toxic Gas disables Thick Skinned
Goop Gas Attack - temporarily disables Thick Skinned

competitiveHistory: Snorlax from Jungle was a solid defensive option that saw play in control and stall strategies. Its Thick Skinned Pokemon Power made it immune to status conditions, which was valuable against decks relying on Paralysis or Poison for control. The card found a niche in Dark Vileplume lock decks after Team Rocket released, where the combination of Trainer lock and status immunity made it difficult for opponents to deal with multiple high-HP Pokemon. However, Muk's Toxic Gas could disable Thick Skinned, and the 4-energy 30-damage attack was not efficient enough for offensive decks.

rulings.ruling: Thick Skinned prevents Snorlax from BECOMING affected by status conditions. If Snorlax is already affected (via Muk or Goop Gas disabling the power), it remains affected.
If Thick Skinned is disabled by Goop Gas Attack or Muk, Snorlax can be inflicted with status conditions. When the power reactivates, existing Poison is removed but Asleep/Confused/Paralyzed remain.
Thick Skinned does not prevent the Burned condition as Burn did not exist when this card was printed.
Body Slam's paralysis effect happens after damage is dealt.
